titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the W. A. Ricketts Diary, 1858

profiledesc.creation: Original EAD encoding by Bethany Anderson according to TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions. September 2011

did.head: Descriptive Summary

extref.corpname: Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin

did.abstract: The W. A. Ricketts Diary, 1858, chronicles Ricketts’ travels through Texas.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: W. A. Ricketts lived in Bell County, Texas, where he worked as a miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The W. A. Ricketts Diary, 1858, chronicles Ricketts’ travels through Texas. Spanning from March to June, the diary discusses traveling by wagon, the landscape, and his fellow travelers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: W. A. Ricketts Diary, 1858, Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Basic processing and cataloging of this collection was supported with funds from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC) for the Briscoe Center’s History Revealed: Bringing Collections to Light project, 2009-2011.
